Name: Lucifer's Legacy: The Meaning of Asymmetry (Dover Books on Science)

ReviewList.Text: I think this was a great book, although it seemed to dwell mostly on anti-particles.  It was easy to read and understand by the average person with an interest in astro physics. It doesn't boggle down one's mind with the math.  I think it's a book that everyone with an interest in this field should read.  I'm glad I read it.

I think this is the best book which Frank Close has written. It explains the consequences of asymmetries in nature and how the underlying symmetries are broken. I learnt quite a bit as to how it operates in biological systems. I thoroughly recommend it.
Not for the physics novice. At times it gets intricate, but worth persevering.

This is a little off beat and I'm not quite at the level of scientific expertise that I can offer a critique. I'm recommending it because there are a lot of ideas here that you don't encounter elsewhere so it's quite stimulating. Of course, he may be dead wrong about these things - I can't say - but it's unique.
It was as captivating as I hoped it would be. Though the title caught my eye on Amazon, the writing kept me glued to my iPad until the very end!
Very interesting, a lot of in depth insight into symmetry and it's breaking.  Highly recommend to anyone interested in the ideas about how this all came to be.
